alert.note: Alert for Pleasants; Ritchie; Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 1:18PM EDT until August 07 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston West Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Washington County in southeastern Ohio... Pleasants County in northwestern West Virginia... Northeastern Ritchie County in northwestern West Virginia... Tyler County in northern West Virginia... * Until 200 PM EDT. * At 118 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near St. Marys, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... St. Marys, Middlebourne, Sistersville, Pennsboro, Belmont, Newport, Matamoras, Friendly, Alma, Willow Island, Maxwell, Arvilla, Point Lookout, New Matamoras, Wick, Mountain, Lima, Hebron, and Highland. This includes Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 41 and 44. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern Ohio...and northern and northwestern West Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern Ohio...and northern and northwestern West Virginia.
